intro: Hieracium schmidtii var. devoniense, commonly known as Devonian Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosettes of leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in grasslands and woodland edges. It is a perennial species with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected plant in some regions.
